intro: Bothriochloa panormitana, commonly known as the Panormitan grass, is a species of grass native to southern Europe, particularly found in regions of Italy and Greece. It is a perennial plant that typically grows in dry, rocky, or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates, showing drought tolerance and resilience to poor soil conditions. The botanical features of Bothriochloa panormitana make it an important component of Mediterranean ecosystems.
